definition: Uliastai, the Qing name for outer Mongolia
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
Qobto or Kobdo, khanate of outer Mongolia
Khalkha, largest subgroup of Mongol people
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Dihua or Tihwa (old name of Ürümqi 烏魯木齊|乌鲁木齐[Wu1 lu3 mu4 qi2])
Chahar Province (former province in North China existing from 1912-1936)
Kashgar or Qeshqer (Chinese Kashi) in the west of Xinjiang near Kyrgyzstan
old name for Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Harqin (Mongol: guard)/Harqin banner or Kharchin khoshuu in Chifeng 赤峰[Chi4 feng1], Inner Mongolia/also Harqin Left Mongol autonomous county in Chaoyang 朝陽|朝阳[Chao2 yang2], Liaoning
Rehe, Qing dynasty province abolished in 1955 and divided among Hebei, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia/refers to the Qing imperial resort at Chengde/see also 避暑山莊|避暑山庄[bi4 shu3 shan1 zhuang1] (history)
Kulun, the former name for modern Ulan Bator, capital of Mongolia (Mongolian: temple)
